item.title: Reports: Suspects came from abroad
item.description: They may have "international ties" and military training, NBC is reporting Friday morning.
item.author: Kevin Robillard

item.title: One suspect dead; suburbs shut down
item.description: "We believe this to be a terrorist," said Boston Police Commissioner Ed Davis.
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: MIT: Campus clear after shooting
item.description: A campus police officer was shot and killed late Thursday night.
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Pete Williams hailed as media hero
item.description: On a story defined by inaccurate reports, NBC's Williams has been calm, diligent and correct.
item.author: DYLAN BYERS

item.title: Digital evidence mounts in Boston
item.description: Developments reinforce the complications of crime solving, even with technology's progression.
item.author: Jessica Meyers

item.title: Gang of Eight rolls dice
item.description: Senators punt on immigration's tax issue.
item.author: Kelsey Snell

item.title: Obama, boxed in
item.description: Obama is damned if he does, damned if he doesn't -- and he knows it, several of his friends tell us.
item.author: Jim VandeHei,Mike Allen

item.title: Dems get immigration concessions
item.description: The overhaul bill is more favorable than expected for their constituencies.
item.author: Carrie Budoff Brown

item.title: How the NRA won
item.description: Facing its first real test in years, the NRA had several factors working in its favor.
item.author: Anna Palmer,John Bresnahan

item.title: Congress at odds after CISPA
item.description: For now, the two chambers just don't see eye to eye on cybersecurity.
item.author: Tony Romm

item.title: Gun vote triggers media outcry
item.description: The right sees bias in the aggressive criticism being leveled at the senators who opposed the plan.
item.author: Dylan Byers

item.title: Photos of Boston suspects released
item.description: Authorities release images of two suspects and call for the public's assistance in finding them.
item.author: Katie Glueck

item.title: Senate panel approves Ernest Moniz
item.description: The energy secretary nominee passes his first test in Congress and even wins over some Republicans.
item.author: Andrew Restuccia

item.title: Senate OKs mental health measure
item.description: The vote comes a day after the Senate rejected broader background checks on gun purchases.
item.author: Paige Winfield Cunningham

item.title: Obama's mission: Reassure, rally
item.description: The president delivers a message of healing and hope in Boston.
item.author: Reid J. Epstein

item.title: Reid: 'Pause and freeze' on guns
item.description: After pulling background checks from the floor, he pledges to bring the measure back for a vote.
item.author: Tarini Parti

item.title: Media shrug at Boston blunders
item.description: It fell to Twitter and the merciless mockery of Jon Stewart to call them out on their failures.
item.author: James Hohmann

item.title: Romney: Obama 'superb' in Boston
item.description: "I thought the president gave a superb address to the people of this city," he says.
item.author: Katie Glueck

item.title: Obama visits Massachusetts General
item.description: The president meets with hospital staffers and victims of Monday's bombing.
item.author: DONOVAN SLACK

item.title: Holder gets stormy reception on Hill
item.description: At an acrimonious subcommittee hearing, Frank Wolf vows to "ignore" the attorney general.
item.author: JOSH GERSTEIN

item.title: N.Y. Post stands by 'Bag Men' story
item.description: The paper's report set off a wave of speculation.
item.author: DYLAN BYERS

item.title: Manchin ponders speed of gun push
item.description: The first days after Newtown "felt different," but as time went on there was "less urgency," he says.
item.author: GLENN THRUSH

item.title: FBI: Tests show ricin in letters
item.description: Paul Kevin Curtis is suspected of sending them to President Obama and Sen. Roger Wicker.
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: 'Magnitsky List': Not perfect
item.description: Opinion: The unveiling of the list underscores a more important point.
item.author: Juleanna Glover

item.title: Va.: Gay marriage ground zero?
item.description: Opinion: Debate could be stirred by a candidate who says there is a right to same-sex marriage.
item.author: Paul Goldman,Mark J. Rozell

item.title: Bush book gives 'Front Row Seat'
item.description: Eric Draper, George W. Bush's personal photographer, chronicles the president's life through pictures.
item.author: Patrick Gavin

item.title: Chained CPI: A conservative skeptic
item.description: Opinion: If lawmakers accept this change, then they politicize inflation.
item.author: Sean Kennedy

item.title: Baucus stirs controversy on all sides
item.description: The Senate Finance chairman is taking heat after he slams the health reform law.
item.author: Kyle Cheney

item.title: Kelly tweets Flake over gun bill vote
item.description: The husband of former Rep. Gabrielle Giffords took to Twitter to chide his fellow Arizonan.
item.author: Kevin Robillard

item.title: Obama approval rating down
item.description: The president hits his lowest rating since reelection, and support slips for his economic stewardship.
item.author: DONOVAN SLACK

item.title: Obama's ode to Coburn
item.description: The president pens a personal tribute to the Oklahoma senator in Time's Top 100.
item.author: DONOVAN SLACK

item.title: Officials: Sequester hurts security
item.description: POLITICO Pro Report: "We won't know what we've missed until something blows up," Angus King says.
item.author: David Nather

item.title: Police arrest Pervez Musharraf
item.description: The former Pakistani leader had fled to Islamabad's outskirts after a judge denied his bail.
item.author: Associated Press

item.title: Bachmann challenger rakes in cash
item.description: Democrat Jim Graves has raked in over $100,000 in the past week.

item.title: Dem ad blitz: Sanford can't be trusted
item.description: The DCCC is spending more than $200,000.

item.title: Wicker had hired 'Elvis' facing threat charges
item.description: He says the impersonator was "quite entertaining."

item.title: PODCAST: Boston, gun control
item.description: POLITICO's Rachel Smolkin, Dan Berman and James Hohmann join host Alexander Trowbridge.

item.title: Producer fights 'Cards' sexist label
item.description: The Netflix series "House of Cards" has gotten flack for misogynistic plotlines.

item.title: DOT: Prepare for air delays next week
item.description: Air traffic controller furloughs will force delays at airports across the country.

item.description: Republican senators grill Tom Perez over a whistleblower lawsuit.

item.title: Lucas to move on farm bill
item.description: Despite pushback from Republican leadership, he wants to keep to his schedule.

item.description: Rand Paul, Joe Biden, Chris Christie, Tom Coburn, Gabby Giffords and others make the list.

item.title: Toomey moves on to 'other issues'
item.description: "I did the best I could," he says of the failed agreement to expand gun background checks.

item.title: Ex-Bachmann aide to testify in probe
item.description: Her former chief of staff is expected to admit her campaign inappropriately paid a state senator.
